title: Bacteria may travel thousands of miles through the air globally

title_detail.value: Bacteria may travel thousands of miles through the air globally

summary: Bacteria may travel thousands of miles through the air worldwide instead of hitching rides with people and animals, according to scientists. Their 'air bridge' hypothesis could shed light on how harmful bacteria share antibiotic resistance genes.

summary_detail.value: Bacteria may travel thousands of miles through the air worldwide instead of hitching rides with people and animals, according to scientists. Their 'air bridge' hypothesis could shed light on how harmful bacteria share antibiotic resistance genes.
